removed.description: Force all freshly committed pages to be pre-touched
removed.name: AlwaysPreTouch

removed.description:
The base target spending used to estimate the inlining threshold; the
higher, the likelier it is to inline.
removed.name: BaseTargetSpending

removed.description: Break chained phis
removed.name: BreakChainedPhis

removed.description:
Controls the maximum number of compiler nodes that can appear in the
call graph
removed.name: CallGraphCompilerNodeLimit

removed.description: Controls the maximum size of the call graph before ceasing inlining.
removed.name: CallGraphSizeLimit

removed.description: Reduces the likelihood of exploring call graph subtrees that are large.
removed.name: CallGraphSizePenaltyCoefficient

removed.description:
Create one reusable isolate per compilation thread as opposed to one
isolate per compilation (enable through CompileInIsolates).
removed.name: CompileInPerThreadReusedIsolates

removed.description:
Controls the likelihood of exploring subtrees that already have a lot
of code during inlining.
removed.name: CompilerNodePenaltyCoefficient

removed.description: Number of threads concurrent gc will use
removed.name: ConcGCThreads

removed.description:
Consider the vectorizability of loop during the duplication of a merge
inside a loop.There are rare cases where duplication can destroy
vectorization.
removed.name: ConsiderVectorizableLoops

removed.description:
PullThroughPhiOptimization: Abstract cost for the creation of a new
live value: new values can have a negativeimpact on register
allocation, therefore we penalize it.
removed.name: CostNewLiveVariable

removed.description:
PullThroughPhiOptimization: Cost/Benefit heuristic for EE floating node
duplication: reduce cost by a constant factor when comparing with
relative benefit.
removed.name: CostReductionFactor

removed.description:
Controls the likelihood of further exploring subtrees with a lot of
code during inlining.
removed.name: CutoffCodeSizePenaltyCoefficient

removed.description: Debug simulation synonyms during simulation-based loop peeling.
removed.name: DebugPeelingSynonyms

removed.description: Perform Duplications as long as there is any sane improvement.
removed.name: DuplicateALot

removed.description:
Percentage in node cost graph size for the duplication budget. Computed
relative to the methods code size.
removed.name: DuplicationBudgetFactor

removed.description:
Percentage in node cost graph size for the late duplication budget.
Computed relative to the methods code size.
removed.name: DuplicationBudgetFactorLate

removed.description:
Cost/Benefit heuristic for EE simulation-based code duplication: reduce
cost by a constant factor when comparing with relative benefit.
removed.name: DuplicationCostReductionFactor

removed.description: Ignore low frequency branches during duplication.
removed.name: DuplicationMinBranchFrequency

removed.description:
Try to eliminate array clone operations by handling clone operations in
early read elimination.
removed.name: EnterpriseCloneReadElimination

removed.description: Run more read eliminations early in the compilation pipeline.
removed.name: EnterpriseEarlyReadElimination

removed.description:
Enable EE version of partial loop unrolling that considers more loop
shapes for unrolling.
removed.name: EnterprisePartialUnroll

removed.description:
Maximum ergonomically set heap size (in bytes); zero means use MaxRAM *
MaxRAMPercentage / 100
removed.name: ErgoHeapSizeLimit

removed.description:
Exclude compilations that MethodFilter.match this string from the
duplication optimization.
removed.name: ExcludeFunctionFromDuplication

removed.description:
The decrease in call graph expansion pressure when there are few call
nodes left to explore.
removed.name: ExpandAllProximityBonus

removed.description:
The inertia at which the expand-all proximity bonus decreases with the
number of yet unexpanded nodes.
removed.name: ExpandAllProximityBonusInertia

removed.description:
The slowness at which the expansion pressure grows with code size; the
higher it is, the slower the pressure growth.
removed.name: ExpansionInertiaBaseValue

removed.description:
The extra slowness at which the expansion pressure grows with the code
size, for each extra invoke node.
removed.name: ExpansionInertiaInvokeBonus

removed.description:
The max slowness at which the expansion pressure grows with the code
size.
removed.name: ExpansionInertiaMax

removed.description: A System.gc() request invokes a concurrent collection
removed.name: ExplicitGCInvokesConcurrent

removed.description: Enable Java Flight Recorder.
removed.name: FlightRecorder

removed.description: Force partial unrolling of loops if at all possible.
removed.name: ForceUnroll

removed.description: Perform full unrolling as a Partial Escape Analysis Cleanup
removed.name: FullUnrollAsPEACleanup

removed.description: Target duration of individual concurrent marking steps in milliseconds.
removed.name: G1ConcMarkStepDurationMillis

removed.description: The threshold that defines (>=) a hot card.
removed.name: G1ConcRSHotCardLimit

removed.description: Log base 2 of the length of conc RS hot-card cache.
removed.name: G1ConcRSLogCacheSize

removed.description:
The number of update buffers that are left in the queue by the
concurrent processing threads. Will be selected ergonomically by
default.
removed.name: G1ConcRefinementGreenZone

removed.description:
Maximum number of enqueued update buffers before mutator threads start
processing new ones instead of enqueueing them. Will be selected
ergonomically by default.
removed.name: G1ConcRefinementRedZone

removed.description:
The last concurrent refinement thread wakes up every specified number
of milliseconds to do miscellaneous work.
removed.name: G1ConcRefinementServiceIntervalMillis

removed.description:
The number of parallel rem set update threads. Will be set
ergonomically by default.
removed.name: G1ConcRefinementThreads

removed.description:
Each time the rset update queue increases by this amount activate the
next refinement thread if available. The actual step size will be
selected ergonomically by default, with this value used to determine a
lower bound.
removed.name: G1ConcRefinementThresholdStep

removed.description:
Number of enqueued update buffers that will trigger concurrent
processing. Will be selected ergonomically by default.
removed.name: G1ConcRefinementYellowZone

removed.description: Confidence level for MMU/pause predictions.
removed.name: G1ConfidencePercent

removed.description:
Amount of space, expressed as a percentage of the heap size, that G1 is
willing not to collect to avoid expensive GCs.
removed.name: G1HeapWastePercent

removed.description: The target number of mixed GCs after a marking cycle.
removed.name: G1MixedGCCountTarget

removed.description:
Number of milliseconds after a previous GC to wait before triggering a
periodic gc. A value of zero disables periodically enforced gc cycles.
removed.name: G1PeriodicGCInterval

removed.description:
Determines the kind of periodic GC. Set to true to have G1 perform a
concurrent GC as periodic GC, otherwise use a STW Full GC.
removed.name: G1PeriodicGCInvokesConcurrent

removed.description:
Maximum recent system wide load as returned by the 1m value of
getloadavg() at which G1 triggers a periodic GC. A load above this
value cancels a given periodic GC. A value of zero disables this check.
removed.name: G1PeriodicGCSystemLoadThreshold

removed.description:
Max number of regions for which we keep bitmaps. Will be set
ergonomically by default
removed.name: G1RSetRegionEntries

removed.description:
Max number of entries per region in a sparse table. Will be set
ergonomically by default.
removed.name: G1RSetSparseRegionEntries

removed.description:
A target percentage of time that is allowed to be spend on process RS
update buffers during the collection pause.
removed.name: G1RSetUpdatingPauseTimePercent

removed.description:
The number of discovered reference objects to process before draining
concurrent marking work queues.
removed.name: G1RefProcDrainInterval

removed.description:
It determines the minimum reserve we should have in the heap to
minimize the probability of promotion failure.
removed.name: G1ReservePercent

removed.description:
Before enqueueing them, each mutator thread tries to do some filtering
on the SATB buffers it generates. If post-filtering the percentage of
retained entries is over this threshold the buffer will be enqueued for
processing. A value of 0 specifies that mutator threads should not do
such filtering.
removed.name: G1SATBBufferEnqueueingThresholdPercent

removed.description: Number of entries in an SATB log buffer.
removed.name: G1SATBBufferSize

removed.description: Size of an update buffer.
removed.name: G1UpdateBufferSize

removed.description:
Select green, yellow and red zones adaptively to meet the the pause
requirements.
removed.name: G1UseAdaptiveConcRefinement

removed.description:
Adaptively adjust the initiating heap occupancy from the initial value
of InitiatingHeapOccupancyPercent. The policy attempts to start marking
in time based on application behavior.
removed.name: G1UseAdaptiveIHOP

removed.description: Verifies the consistency of the marking bitmaps
removed.name: G1VerifyBitmaps

removed.description: Verify the code root lists attached to each heap region.
removed.name: G1VerifyHeapRegionCodeRoots

removed.description:
If true, perform verification of each heap region's remembered set when
verifying the heap during a full GC.
removed.name: G1VerifyRSetsDuringFullGC

removed.description: Number of entries we will try to leave on the stack during parallel gc
removed.name: GCDrainStackTargetSize

removed.description: Time slice for MMU specification
removed.name: GCPauseIntervalMillis

removed.description: Adaptive size policy application time to GC time ratio
removed.name: GCTimeRatio

removed.description: Generate debuginfo for runtime-compiled code.
removed.name: GenerateRuntimeDebugInfo

removed.description:
Size of heap (bytes) per GC thread used in calculating the number of GC
threads
removed.name: HeapSizePerGCThread

removed.description: Enable EE partial unrolling in high tier.
removed.name: HighTierPartialUnrolling

removed.description: Ignore duplications with a bad benefit cost relation.
removed.name: IgnoreBadDuplications

removed.description: Initial heap size (in bytes); zero means use ergonomics
removed.name: InitialHeapSize

removed.description: Percentage of real memory used for initial heap size
removed.name: InitialRAMPercentage

removed.description:
The percent occupancy (IHOP) of the current old generation capacity
above which a concurrent mark cycle will be initiated. Its value may
change over time if adaptive IHOP is enabled, otherwise the value
remains constant. In the latter case a value of 0 will result as
frequent as possible concurrent marking cycles. A value of 100 disables
concurrent marking. Fragmentation waste in the old generation is not
considered free space in this calculation.
removed.name: InitiatingHeapOccupancyPercent

removed.description: The bonus applied to call nodes that can be fully inlined.
removed.name: InlineAllBonus

removed.description:
Controls the maximum number of compiler nodes that can be inlined into
the compiled method.
removed.name: InlinedCompilerNodeLimit

removed.description:
The coefficient used to compute the inlining threshold; the higher, the
more to inline.
removed.name: InliningCoefficient

removed.description: Do not unroll the main loop, only create pre-main-post.
removed.name: InsertPreMainPostOnly

removed.description: Inspect analysis graphs.
removed.name: InspectGraphs

removed.description:
Reduces the likelihood of exploring call graphs that have a lot of
children below the root.
removed.name: LargeChildrenCountPenaltyCoefficient

removed.description: Size of marking stack
removed.name: MarkStackSize

removed.description: Maximum size of marking stack
removed.name: MarkStackSizeMax

removed.description:
Upper bound on the number of cpu locals per counter. It has to be a
power of 2.
removed.name: MaxCpuLocalsPerCounter

removed.description:
Adaptive size policy maximum GC pause time goal in millisecond, or the
maximum GC time per MMU time slice
removed.name: MaxGCPauseMillis

removed.description:
Maximum node cost graph size for duplication. If a graph is bigger
duplication will stop.
removed.name: MaxGraphSizeNodeCost

removed.description:
Abstract measure of the cost of branch misprediction. Higher values
make generation of conditional moves more likely.
removed.name: MaxMispredictionCostIncreaseFactor

removed.description: The maximum number of dispatches in guarded polymorphic inlining.
removed.name: MaxPolymorphicDispatches

removed.description: Max number of precise inlining peeling iterations.
removed.name: MaxPriorityInliningPeelingIterations

removed.description: Real memory size (in bytes) used to set maximum heap size
removed.name: MaxRAM

removed.description: Maximum percentage of real memory used for maximum heap size
removed.name: MaxRAMPercentage

removed.description:
Maximum simulation-duplication iterations of the duplication
optimization per invocation.
removed.name: MaxSimulationIterations

removed.description: Maximum value for tenuring threshold
removed.name: MaxTenuringThreshold

removed.description: Maximum number of unrolled alignment instructions
removed.name: MaxVectorAlignmentUnroll

removed.description: Maximum length of linear-code vector operations
removed.name: MaxVectorUnroll

removed.description:
PullThroughPhiOptimization: Maximum number of algorithm iterations per
optimization invocation.
removed.name: MaximumTransitiveEnabledPullFactor

removed.description: Enable EE partial unrolling in mid tier.
removed.name: MidTierPartialUnrolling

removed.description:
PullThroughPhiOptimization: Ignore low frequency branches during
duplication.
removed.name: MinBlockFrequencyPull

removed.description: The minimum change in heap space due to GC (in bytes).
removed.name: MinHeapDeltaBytes

removed.description: The minimum percentage of heap free after GC to avoid expansion.
removed.name: MinHeapFreeRatio

removed.description:
The minimum probability for using a dispatch in guarded polymorphic
inlining.
removed.name: MinPolymorphicDispatchProbability

removed.description:
Minimum percentage of real memory used for maximum heap size on systems
with small physical memory size
removed.name: MinRAMPercentage

removed.description: Minimum allowed TLAB size (in bytes)
removed.name: MinTLABSize

removed.description: Break chained phis
removed.name: MinifyInvertedPhis

removed.description: Try to reduce duplication code size to the minimal amount of code.
removed.name: MinimalRegions

removed.description:
Cost/Benefit heuristic for EE unrolling: If a loop has multiple exits,
cost is increased by this value for every none-sinking loop exit.
removed.name: MultiExitCostFactor

removed.description:
Cost/Benefit heuristic for EE unrolling: If a loop has multiple exits,
cost is increased by this value for every sinking loop exit.
removed.name: MultiExitCostFactorSink

removed.description: Ratio of old/new generation sizes
removed.name: NewRatio

removed.description: Initial new generation size (in bytes)
removed.name: NewSize

removed.description: Size of old gen promotion LAB's (in HeapWords)
removed.name: OldPLABSize

removed.description: Initial tenured generation size (in bytes)
removed.name: OldSize

removed.description: Optimize simple if branches with conditional moves
removed.name: OptConditionalMoves

removed.description: Inject stamps on induction variables.
removed.name: OptLoopPhiStamps

removed.description: Propagate equality into dominated nodes.
removed.name: OptPropagateEquality

removed.description: Optimize StringBuilder construction
removed.name: OptStringConcat

removed.description: Dump graphs to help debug operation
removed.name: OptStringConcatDump

removed.description: Eliminate redundant write barriers.
removed.name: OptWriteBarrierElimination

removed.description: Enable access node optimizations for loops
removed.name: OptimizeLoopAccesses

removed.description: Dump information for Profile Guided Optimizations (true or file name)
removed.name: PGOInstrument

removed.description:
Percentage (0-100) used to weight the current sample when computing
exponentially decaying average for ResizePLAB
removed.name: PLABWeight

removed.description:
Scan a subset of object array and push remainder, if array is bigger
than this
removed.name: ParGCArrayScanChunk

removed.description: Wasted fraction of parallel allocation buffer
removed.name: ParallelGCBufferWastePct

removed.description: Number of parallel threads parallel gc will use
removed.name: ParallelGCThreads

removed.description: Enable balancing of reference processing queues
removed.name: ParallelRefProcBalancingEnabled

removed.description: Enable parallel reference processing whenever possible
removed.name: ParallelRefProcEnabled

removed.description: Enable partial redundancy elimination
removed.name: PartialRedundancyElimination

removed.description:
Cost/Benefit heuristic for EE unrolling in high tier: reduce cost by a
constant factor when comparing with relative benefit.
removed.name: PartialUnrollCostReductionFactorHighTier

removed.description:
Cost/Benefit heuristic for EE unrolling in mid tier: reduce cost by a
constant factor when comparing with relative benefit.
removed.name: PartialUnrollCostReductionFactorMidTier

removed.description: Maximum number of iterations to unroll for a high tier main loop.
removed.name: PartialUnrollMaxIterationsHighTier

removed.description: Maximum number of iterations to unroll for a mid tier main loop.
removed.name: PartialUnrollMaxIterationsMidTier

removed.description:
Maximum node cost size of a loop to be considered for high tier
unrolling.
removed.name: PartialUnrollMaxSizeHighTier

removed.description:
Maximum node cost size of a loop to be considered for mid tier tier
unrolling.
removed.name: PartialUnrollMaxSizeMidTier

removed.description: Minimal loop frequency to consider a loop for partial unrolling
removed.name: PartialUnrollMinFrequency

removed.description:
The limit on the number of paths at control-flow merges. Decreasing
this value reduces the number of paths, but also shortens them.
removed.name: PathProfileCutThreshold

removed.description:
Dump information for path profile (null or file name). If set to null,
then dumping is disabled.
removed.name: PathProfileDumpFile

removed.description:
Maximum acceptable number of paths coming from the inbound of a merge
if both of them are frequent.
removed.name: PathProfileFrequentThreshold

removed.description:
If some block's relative frequency drops below this number times the
maximum relative frequency in the graph, then the block is considered
infrequent.
removed.name: PathProfileGlobalLowFrequencyRatio

removed.description:
If the ratio of the merge's frequency with its inbound's frequency is
greater than this threshold, then the inbound is considered infrequent.
removed.name: PathProfileLocalLowFrequencyRatio

removed.description:
Maximum number of counters to use in path profiling for all
instrumented methods.
removed.name: PathProfileMaxTotalCounters

removed.description:
Enable or disable the path-profiling algorithm. If it enables it, it
also allows to select which mode to execute.
removed.name: PathProfilePolicy

removed.description: Controls whether the path-regeneration algorithm is executed.
removed.name: PathProfileRegenerate

removed.description: Minimal loop frequency necessary to consider peeling.
removed.name: PeelingConsideredMinFrequency

removed.description:
Increase the cost of duplicating control flow splits inside loops if
they are not foldable.The generally tend to complicate control flow and
generate worse code in the backend.
removed.name: PenalizeComplexLoopControlFlow

removed.description:
Size of performance data memory region. Will be rounded up to a
multiple of the native os page size.
removed.name: PerfDataMemorySize

removed.description: Jvmstat instrumentation sampling interval (in milliseconds)
removed.name: PerfDataSamplingInterval

removed.description: Maximum PerfStringConstant string length before truncation
removed.name: PerfMaxStringConstLength

removed.description: Minimal loop frequency to consider a loop for inverted phi minifaction.
removed.name: PhiMinificationMinimalLoopFrequency

removed.description: Per-thread chunk size for parallel memory pre-touch.
removed.name: PreTouchParallelChunkSize

removed.description: How far ahead to prefetch destination area (<= 0 means off)
removed.name: PrefetchCopyIntervalInBytes

removed.description: How far ahead to prefetch scan area (<= 0 means off)
removed.name: PrefetchScanIntervalInBytes

removed.description: The policy to use, must be empty for automatic resolution.
removed.name: PriorityInliningPolicy

removed.description:
Comma-separated list of analysis policies for exploring the methods in
the call graph and for inlining, empty for no policy.
removed.name: PriorityInliningTuningPolicy

removed.description:
Integer greater than zero representing the duration in seconds that
will be used to trigger a profile capture. Any integer less than one
disables periodic dumps
removed.name: ProfileDumpPeriod

removed.description:
Excludes time spent in invoked methods; measures total time including
subcalls when turned off.
removed.name: ProfileSelfTime

removed.description: Value should point to a profile dump file.
removed.name: ProfilesDumpFile

removed.description: Maximum depth of dependency when propagating equals property.
removed.name: PropagateEqualityDepth

removed.description:
PullThroughPhiOptimization: Percentage in node cost graph size for the
floating node duplication budget. Computed relative to the method's
graph size.
removed.name: PullThroughPhiCodeSizeIncrease

removed.description:
Number of times an allocation that queues behind a GC will retry before
printing a warning
removed.name: QueuedAllocationWarningCount

removed.description:
Select type of reference discovery policy: reference-based(0) or
referent-based(1)
removed.name: RefDiscoveryPolicy

removed.description:
The coefficient used to compute the inlining threshold; the higher, the
hard to inline.
removed.name: RelativeBenefitInliningCoefficient

removed.description: Dynamically resize (survivor space) promotion LAB's
removed.name: ResizePLAB

removed.description: Dynamically resize TLAB size for threads
removed.name: ResizeTLAB

removed.description: Try avoid unrolling vectorizable loops.
removed.name: RespectVectorization

removed.description: Directory where Java source-files will be placed for the debugger
removed.name: RuntimeSourceDestDir

removed.description: Set the number of dominating and dominated blocks scanned per block
removed.name: SIMDVectorizationWindowSize

removed.description:
Simulation can either only process fixed nodes or schedule the graph
and also process floating nodes.
removed.name: ScheduledDuplicationSimulation

removed.description: Use DBDS algorithm to simulate the impact of peeling on a loop.
removed.name: SimulationBasedLoopPeeling

removed.description: Ignore low frequency branches during simulation.
removed.name: SimulationPruneUnlikelyBranches

removed.description:
Reduces the likelihood of exploring call graphs with IR size much
larger than the root.
removed.name: SmallRootIrPenaltyCoefficient

removed.description: Number of milliseconds per MB of free space in the heap.
removed.name: SoftRefLRUPolicyMSPerMB

removed.description: Speculates that arrays have exact type to optimize store checks
removed.name: SpeculativeStoreCheck

removed.description: Start flight recording with options.
removed.name: StartFlightRecording

removed.description: Ratio of eden/survivor space size
removed.name: SurvivorRatio

removed.description: Allocation averaging weight
removed.name: TLABAllocationWeight

removed.description: Maximum TLAB waste at a refill (internal fragmentation)
removed.name: TLABRefillWasteFraction

removed.description: Starting TLAB size (in bytes); zero means set ergonomically
removed.name: TLABSize

removed.description: Increment allowed waste at slow allocation
removed.name: TLABWasteIncrement

removed.description: Percentage of Eden that can be wasted
removed.name: TLABWasteTargetPercent

removed.description: Target wasted space in last buffer as percent of overall allocation
removed.name: TargetPLABWastePct

removed.description: Desired percentage of survivor space used after scavenge
removed.name: TargetSurvivorRatio

removed.description: Profile method execution time.
removed.name: TimeStampProfiling

removed.description: Enables detailed tracing of auxiliary image events.
removed.name: TraceAuxiliaryImageClassHistogram

removed.description: Enables detailed tracing of auxiliary image events.
removed.name: TraceAuxiliaryImageReferenceTree

removed.description:
Enable (if Count is enabled) graph size tracking during every
duplication iteration.
removed.name: TrackGraphSizesInDuplication

removed.description:
Track inlining statistics (inlining duration, call tree size, compiler
node counts, and the number of callsites). One of: none, interactive
removed.name: TrackInliningStatistics

removed.description:
Loop peeling will consider any loop with a size (in terms of estimated
machine instructions) below this value to be a prime candidate for
peeling. Larger loops will only be considered for peeling if the
simulated benefit of peeling is relatively high. The larger the loop,
the greater the expected benefit has to be.
removed.name: TrivialLoopSizeLimitForPeeling

removed.description:
PullThroughPhiOptimization: Enable floating node duplication over
multiple phi nodes at once.
removed.name: TryExplodeOverPhis

removed.description:
PullThroughPhiOptimization: Enable floating node duplication over phis
where the target node has different phis as input.
removed.name: TryPhiPhiPulls

removed.description:
Increases or decreases the time spent exploring inlining opportunities
under the assumption that more time results in better peak performance
and less time reduces time to reach (a lower) peak performance. The
value of the option is clamped between -1 and 1 inclusive. Anything
below 0, reduces the exploration time and anything above 0 increases
exploration time. Note that this option is only a heuristic and should
be tuned for any specific application.
removed.name: TuneInlinerExploration

removed.description:
How many levels of inputs to print. A value of 0 prints only the target
flow.
removed.name: TypeFlowPrinterInRadius

removed.description:
How many levels of outputs to print. A value of 0 prints only the
target flow.
removed.name: TypeFlowPrinterOutRadius

removed.description: Denotes the call graph size that is considered medium size.
removed.name: TypicalCallGraphSize

removed.description: The typical graph size at which inlining pressure must start growing.
removed.name: TypicalGraphSize

removed.description:
The increase in estimated typical graph size after inlining, per each
extra invoke.
removed.name: TypicalGraphSizeInvokeBonus

removed.description: The maximum in estimated inlined typical graph size.
removed.name: TypicalGraphSizeMax

removed.description: Unroll empty loops.
removed.name: UnrollEmptyLoops

removed.description: Unroll inverted (tail counted) loops.
removed.name: UnrollInvertedLoops

removed.description: Unroll loops with multiple loop ends.
removed.name: UnrollMultiEndLoops

removed.description: Unroll loops with multiple loop exits.
removed.name: UnrollMultiExitLoops

removed.description:
Dynamically choose the number of threads up to a maximum of
ParallelGCThreads parallel collectors will use for garbage collection
work
removed.name: UseDynamicNumberOfGCThreads

removed.description: Turn on graph caching.
removed.name: UseGraphCache

removed.description: Flag to disable jvmstat instrumentation for performance testing.
removed.name: UsePerfData

removed.description: Use priority-based inlining.
removed.name: UsePriorityInlining

removed.description: Use absolute path for source-filenames in VTune events.
removed.name: VTuneAbsoluteFilenames

removed.description:
Only generate SIMD loops for vector folds expected to iterate at least
this many times.
removed.name: VectorFoldMinIterations

removed.description: Enable vectorized array copy intrinsics
removed.name: VectorIntrinsics

removed.description: Unroll vectorized loops
removed.name: VectorUnroll

removed.description: Enable vectorization.
removed.name: Vectorization

removed.description: Enable vectorized array initialization
removed.name: VectorizeAllocation

removed.description: Enable vectorization of conditional code.
removed.name: VectorizeConditional

removed.description: Enable vectorization of loops with conditional deopts before writes.
removed.name: VectorizeDeopts

removed.description:
Enable vectorization of loops implementing a higher-order 'fold'
function.
removed.name: VectorizeFoldShaped

removed.description: Enable vectorization of vector gather operations.
removed.name: VectorizeGather

removed.description: Enable vectorization of hashCode patterns.
removed.name: VectorizeHashes

removed.description: Enable vectorization of loops
removed.name: VectorizeLoops

removed.description:
Enable vectorization of loops implementing a higher-order 'map'
function.
removed.name: VectorizeMapShaped

removed.description: Enable vectorization of loops with negative strides.
removed.name: VectorizeNegativeStride

removed.description: Enable detection of SIMD patterns
removed.name: VectorizeSIMD

removed.description: Enable vectorization of loops with safepoints.
removed.name: VectorizeSafepoints

removed.description: Enable vectorization of sequence values.
removed.name: VectorizeSequence

removed.description: Verify memory system after GC
removed.name: VerifyAfterGC
